column1: It's a disgrace that Mitch McConnell has rushed the process to confirm a new Supreme Court justice while he's stalled COVID relief and left hundreds of bipartisan bills on his desk without action.

We must come together to get more support for the American people in response to COVID-19.  That should include making strong investments in our communities education small businesses and workers. I won't be satisfied until we get something over the finish line. #NHpolitics https://t.co/txhWtfhLlr

While Mr. Mowers was focused on leveling baseless attacks against me and misrepresenting my record I spoke about specific ways we can help Granite Staters by passing a new COVID-19 relief package protecting affordable health care and bringing our economy back from the brink.

We are the midst of a national crisis right now with the COVID-19 pandemic and what is most important is that we have a substantive discussion so that the voters can learn where we stand on the issues.

This is the crucial question: how can we bring people together to get a COVID-19 response bill. That must include support for our local businesses help for Granite Staters who are out of work and funding for local cities and towns.   That's what I'm fighting for.  #WMURdebate

With COVID-19 surging nationally and some tough months ahead of us our strategy must be based in science and driven by the recommendations of our public health experts.  It’s shameful that the President is again undermining the people who are working to keep us safe. #NHPolitics https://t.co/gxYa0CvJZF

It was great to meet with workers students and business leaders in Laconia this week. Glad to have the chance to talk about COVID-19 relief improving our infrastructure and more. #NHPolitics #NH01 https://t.co/t2U2j03FBh

Toured Lakes Region Comm. College this morning to learn more about their workforce programs. LRCC has been able to use CARES Act funds to keep students safe during the COVID-19 pandemic expand training programs and connect students with jobs at local manufacturers. #NHPolitics https://t.co/PpgoHUh2fL
I hope President Trump and the First Lady have a quick and full recovery from COVID-19. My thoughts are with them our country and the many others suffering from this virus.

Coronavirus relief for our households small businesses and communities can’t wait and I’m encouraged we will take up legislation tonight that meets the growing need and will save lives. #NHPolitics #NH01

Rushing a Supreme Court nomination through the Senate while a COVID relief package remains stalled is a disgrace especially when it’s being done to take away health care and basic rights.  The American people will see through this farce. #NHPolitics #NH01

We need to ensure our schools are safe and prepared for in person and remote learning. That’s why I’m fighting for this legislation to ensure FEMA reimburses communities for PPE and other COVID-19 expenses.  #NHPolitics #NH01 https://t.co/h2wJPxhdjS

Our schools are working hard to ensure a safe start to the school year. FEMA's last minute decision not to offer reimbursements for COVID expenses is wrong.  I've co-sponsored legislation to reverse this decision and will keep working to move it forward. https://t.co/SSua8kmAJi

Facts are stubborn things. And the facts (and the tapes) prove that it didn’t have to be this way. The President downplayed the danger of COVID-19 from the start and our country is paying dearly.  https://t.co/aZUnRlRLm8

COVID-19 has upended our economy but our communities are pulling together. Thanks to local leaders in Portsmouth for creating a safe outdoor dining and entertainment venue with PopUpNH. I’ll continue to advocate for more support for our small businesses in these uncertain times. https://t.co/xA0lc75rh0

First stop of the day at Enna Chocolate in Exeter to discuss the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic on Main Street businesses. Thank you to Enna for hosting us and @JonMorganNH and Select Board members for joining us! https://t.co/aI6g9POqdn

Nearly 1 in 5 New Hampshire workers commute out of state for work. While many are teleworking because of COVID-19 it is completely unfair for states like Massachusetts to levy an income tax on people working in NH.   This bill will help ⬇️ https://t.co/aNYJyJBay3

Cities towns and counties need support to maintain essential services like education health fire EMS and law enforcement.   We can't keep communities safe and healthy without federal funds in the next COVID-19 bill.  My op-ed with @SenatorHosmer ⬇️  https://t.co/7hecUs0btS

We must do better than the GOP COVID relief proposal:  ❌ $1.75b for new FBI hq but nothing for state/local government to protect jobs & services  ❌ $7b for weapons but nothing for food or rental assistance  ❌ Tax deductions for business lunches but scraps for those out of work

Delays in COVID-19 test results are putting people at risk for their lives. I spoke with @WMUR9 about the need to increase testing and contact tracing capacity. That's what I'm advocating for in upcoming legislation.    https://t.co/TxkpRMnrWX

This is no strategy to take on a global pandemic or protect American lives. Retreating from the world stage will only hurt COVID-19 response efforts and embolden China.  This isn’t leadership. This is recklessness. https://t.co/pEHVA3paIa

Looking forward to thanking Elise Sullivan on FB live later this morning at 11am.  Join us and hear about how her tireless work processing COVID-19 lab tests is making a difference:  https://t.co/35zuhYYL05 https://t.co/NrHjdl1bMe

Running the @bostonmarathon is an experience unlike any other. Today thousands of runners stayed home to ensure that we all stay safe. Our COVID-19 response is a marathon effort. We must work hard be patient and stay focused so we can get back up and running. #BostonMarathon https://t.co/YMzufAuXAQ

Thank you Ellie and The Little Green staff for a great conversation about everything from politics and policy to COVID-19 to my favorite CHS classes.  I'm glad student journalism is thriving at Central especially in these difficult times. We need your work now more than ever. https://t.co/NqlQB1Xdxx

Watching the rest of the debate on the coronavirus relief package from my office.  Looking forward to heading down to the floor soon to vote (in an orderly socially-distanced fashion as recommended). https://t.co/ctpwEKKyZr

Driving down to DC tonight so I can vote tomorrow on the coronavirus response package.   Support for our workers small businesses and hospitals can’t wait. That’s why I’m ready to send this bipartisan bill to the President for his signature. #NHpolitics https://t.co/lT4HfYRMcQ

If you are a Granite Stater who has questions or concerns about the coronavirus its impact in New Hampshire and precautions you should take - you can call the state’s 24/7 hotline by dialing 2-1-1. https://t.co/Lpr9DXkvjF
